text: The Mongolian Football Federation () is the governing body of football in Mongolia. It was founded in 1959, and gained both FIFA and AFC affiliation in 1998. Its top league is the National Premier League. ==Association staff== {|class="wikitable hlist" style="text-align:left" !Name !Position !Source |- | Ganbaatar Amgalanbaatar |President |https://www.fifa.com/associations/association/mng/about |- | Dashnyam Ganzorig |Vice President |https://www.fifa.com/associations/association/mng/about |- | Shijir Ulziikhuu |General Secretary |https://www.fifa.com/associations/association/mng/about |- | Enkhtuvshin Tumenjargal |Treasurer |https://www.fifa.com/associations/association/mng/about |- |Hatem Souissi |Technical Director |https://www.fifa.com/associations/association/mng/about |- | Michael Weiß |Team Coach (Men's) |https://www.fifa.com/associations/association/mng/about |- | Iki Youji |Team Coach (Women's) |https://www.fifa.com/associations/association/mng/about |- |n/a |Media/Communications Manager | |- | Azzaya Otgonbayar |Futsal Coordinator | |- |n/a |Referee Coordinator | |- |} ==See also== *Mongolia national football team *Mongolian Premier League ==References== ==External links== * Football Federation of Mongolia * Mongolia at the FIFA website. * Mongolia at AFC site * Mongolia at the EAFF website. *Mongolian Football Central Category:Football in Mongolia Category:1959 establishments in Mongolia Mongolia Football Category:Sports organizations established in 1959
